alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Chilton; Clay; Coosa; Shelby; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:47PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Chilton, southwestern Talladega, southeastern Shelby, east central Bibb, Coosa and southwestern Clay Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bald Rock to near Vincent to near Columbiana to near Centreville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Talladega, Sylacauga, Calera, Clanton, Childersburg, Jemison, Goodwater, Rockford, Talladega Springs, Stewartville, Weogufka, Vincent, Thorsby, Harpersville, Oak Grove, Waldo, Bon Air, Alpine Bay Resort, Dollar and Bradford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Bibb; Chilton; Clay; Coosa; Shelby; Talladega
